p: A>G and T>C changes are evenly represented with respect to SNV frequency ( Fig. 2A), the number of unique SNVs ( Fig. 2, B and C), and their distribution across the viral genome ( Fig. 2D). As ADARs target dsRNA, this suggests that dsRNA encompasses the entire genome. While dsRNA in human transcripts is often driven by inverted repeats, the most likely source of dsRNA in the viral transcripts is replication, where both positive and negative strands are present and can result in wide regions of dsRNA.
